bs-ns_all:
Label used in namespace dropdown lists for all namespaces.
{{Identical|All}}
bs-tab_navigation:
Label for "nagivation" tab in left sidebar
{{Identical|Navigation}}
bs-userbar_loginswitch_logout:
Label for logout button in personal toolbar.
{{Identical|Log out}}
bs-userbar_loginswitch_login:
Label for login button in personal toolbar.
{{Identical|Log in}}
bs-extended-search-tooltip-fulltext: Tooltip shown on mouse over the button at the corner of the search field on every page when in fulltext mode
bs-extended-search-textfield-defaultvalu:
Default text of the search field shown on every page.
{{Identical|Search}}
bs-extended-search-textfield-tooltip: Tootip shown on mouse over the search field on every page
bs-no-information-available: Default text shown in widgets when there is no content
bs-years-duration:
Text for more than one year in a duration. Used in {{msg-mw|bs-one-unit-ago}} and {{msg-mw|bs-two-units-ago}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a positive number
{{Identical|Year}}
bs-months-duration:
Text for more than one month in a duration. Used in {{msg-mw|bs-one-unit-ago}} and {{msg-mw|bs-two-units-ago}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a positive number
{{Identical|Month}}
bs-weeks-duration:
Text for more than one week in a duration. Used in {{msg-mw|bs-one-unit-ago}} and {{msg-mw|bs-two-units-ago}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a positive number
{{Identical|Week}}
bs-days-duration:
Text for more than one day in a duration. Used in {{msg-mw|bs-one-unit-ago}} and {{msg-mw|bs-two-units-ago}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a positive number
{{Identical|Day}}
bs-hours-duration:
Text for more than one hour in a duration. Used in {{msg-mw|bs-one-unit-ago}} and {{msg-mw|bs-two-units-ago}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a positive number
{{Identical|Hour}}
bs-mins-duration:
Text for more than one minute in a duration. Used in {{msg-mw|bs-one-unit-ago}} and {{msg-mw|bs-two-units-ago}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a positive number
{{Identical|Minute}}
bs-secs-duration:
Text for more than one second in a duration. Used in {{msg-mw|bs-one-unit-ago}} and {{msg-mw|bs-two-units-ago}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - a positive number
{{Identical|Second}}
bs-now:
Text shown for "now" when indicating how long ago an event was.
{{Identical|Now}}
bs-email-greeting-receiver:
Used in emails as first line in body to greet the receiver.

Parameters:
* $1 is the username of the receiver - use for GENDER distinction 
*$2 is real name of the receiver, if the receiver has not set a real name it is the username
bs-email-footer:
Used in mails as last line
* $1 is the site name ($wgSitename)
bs-userpagesettings-legend: Label for section with links to special user related settings
bs-userpreferences-link-text: Label for link to user preferences on user page
bs-userpreferences-link-title: Title (shown as flyout) for link to user preferences on user page
bs-exception-view-text: First line of an error message
bs-exception-view-admin-hint: Text in error message with additional hints, e.g. contact the administrator
bs-readonly:
Shown in various messages when database is in readonly mode and a write operation is requested.

Parameters:
* $1 - explanation as given in $wgReadOnly
bs-imageofotheruser: Error message when user tries to upload an avatar for another user
bs-permissionerror:
Error message sent in ajax requests when user has no permissions to perform that action
{{Identical|Permission error}}
bs-lockdown-groups-permissionerror:
Error message when a user cannot perform a specific action, because it was locked down by the groups module.
* $1 - action that was locked down
* $2 - number of reasons, why this action was locked down
* $3 - comma-separated list of reasons, why this action was locked down
bs-filesystemhelper-no-directory:
Error message given when requested directory is not a directory, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the requested directory
bs-filesystemhelper-has-path-traversal:
Error message given when a file path tries to access files outside mediawiki root.

See [[w:Directory traversal attack]].
bs-filesystemhelper-file-not-exists:
Error message given when a file does not exist, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the file
bs-filesystemhelper-file-copy-error:
Error message given when a file could not be copied, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the file
bs-filesystemhelper-file-already-exists:
Error message given when a file already exists, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the file
bs-filesystemhelper-file-delete-error:
Error message given when a file could not be deleted, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the file
bs-filesystemhelper-folder-already-exist:
Error message given when a folder already exists, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the folder
bs-filesystemhelper-folder-copy-error:
Error message given when a folder could not be copied, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the folder
bs-filesystemhelper-folder-not-exists:
Error message given when a folder does not exists, put $1 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the folder
bs-filesystemhelper-folder-rename-error:
Error message given when a folder could not be renamed, put $1 and $2 in code tags

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the folder to be renamed
* $2 - name of the folder to be renamed to
bs-filesystemhelper-upload-err-code:
Error message given when a file could not be uploaded, full stop included in $1.

Parameters:
* $1 - a string indicating the reason
See also:
* {{msg-mw|Bs-filesystemhelper-upload-base64-error}}
bs-filesystemhelper-upload-wrong-ext:
Error message given when an uploaded file does not have the required file extension

Parameters:
* $1 - the required file extension
bs-filesystemhelper-upload-unsupported-t: Error message given when an uploaded file has a file type that is not supported
bs-navigation-instructions:
Used in navigation for instuctions link
{{Identical|Instruction}}
bs-navigation-support:
Used in navigation for support link
{{Identical|Support}}
bs-navigation-contact:
Used in navigation for contact link
{{Identical|Contact}}
bs-ns:
Text message for namespace used multiple times in different situations
{{Identical|Namespace}}
bs-from-something:
This is a suffix for a couple of messages. The meaning of this message is to show the origin of something.

Used in {{msg-mw|Bs-namespacemanager-willmovesuffix}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - the origin for example a namespace
{{Identical|From}}
bs-pref-fileextensions: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for allowed file extensions
bs-pref-imageextensions: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for allowed image extensions
bs-pref-logopath: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for the path to logo
bs-pref-faviconpath: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for the path to favicon
bs-pref-defaultuserimage: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for default user avatar
bs-pref-miniprofileenforceheight: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for force height of user avatar
bs-pref-anonuserimage: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for anonymous user avatar
bs-pref-deleteduserimage: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for deleted user avatar
bs-pref-bspinginterval: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for ping interval (in seconds)
bs-pref-testmode: Option in [{{canonicalurl:Special:WikiAdmin|mode=Preferences}} Special:WikiAdmin?mode=Preferences], label for activate test mode
bs-tag-input-desc: Description of the 'input' part of a tag extension. The 'input' is everything that is placed between the opening and the closing element of the tag extension
bs-tag-param-desc:
Description of a 'parameter' part of a tag extension. A 'parameter' is everything that is defined using attributes of the tag extension's element.

Parameters:
* $1 - the name of the attribute
bs-parser-error-invalid-namespace:
Error message in case a string could not be parsed into a valid namespace id.

Parameters:
* $1 - the original string value
bs-parser-error-invalid-title:
Error message in case a string could not be parsed into a valid Title object.

Parameters:
* $1 - the original string value
bs-validator-error-namespace-does-not-ex:
Error message in case a given namespace id does not exist.

Parameters:
* $1 - the namespace id
bs-validator-error-namespace-on-blacklis:
Error message in case a given namespace id is on the blacklist.

Parameters:
* $1 - the namespace id
bs-validator-error-title-does-not-exist:
Error message in case a given Title object does not exist.

Parameters:
* $1 - the prefixed text of the Title
bs-validator-error-title-namespace-on-bl:
Error message in case the namespace of a given Title object is on the blacklist.

Parameters:
* $1 - the prefixed text of the Title
bs-parser-error-invalid-category-title:
Error message in case given page title is not a valid category Title. 

Parameters:
* $1 - page title to create category Title object from
bs-exttype-bluespice: This is the name of the extension group on [[Special:Version]].
bs-export-menu-print-title: Tooltip for the button to display printable version of the page.
bs-graphicallist-action-close:
Tooltip for the button to close graphicalList view
{{Identical|Close}}
bs-graphicallist-action-list:
Tooltip for the button to show the graphicalList content as list
{{Identical|List}}
bs-graphicallist-action-preview:
Tooltip for the button to show the graphicalList content as preview
{{Identical|Preview}}
bs-bluespice-mediawiki:
Name of the BlueSpice MediaWiki distribution
{{Identical|BlueSpice MediaWiki}}
bs-bluespice:
Name of the BlueSpice MediaWiki distribution (short)
{{Identical|BlueSpice}}
bs-notifications-agent-anon: Text used instead of username when user is anonymous
protect-level-editor:
Used as protect level.

See example: {{canonicalurl:Main_Page|action=info}}
bs-dynamic-settings-error-config-file-co:
Error message in manager interfaces in case a file could not be written not the filesystem. 

Parameters:
* $1 - name of the file
bs-exttype-bluespice-assets: This is the name of the assets group on [[Special:Version]].
